update.description:
Integrated qwt to create plots. 

  - The axis labels are currently hardcoded. 

  - Y axis will auto-scale but disabled when user zooms/pans with the mouse. 

  - X-axis auto scrolls as new data come in. Window size is set to 10 simulation seconds.

Integrated introspection client in PlotManager to provide `sim_time`. Also added sample data for a few test variables in the palette. 

Things to try:

- add a variable to the y container to create a new plot

- add a variable to another variable (which creates a multi-variable) to see one plot with multiple "plot curves"

- delete a variable to remove the corresponding plot curve

- reset simulation to see new plot curves added to the existing plot

TODOs

- Make plot title and variable labels editable

- Improve user interaction with plot (zoom, pan, etc)
update.title: Plot Window: part 3 - Canvas, plot, curve

content.raw:
Just a note for the future. When you start moving pills around, the order in which they are in the `y` field may become different from the order they show on the canvas:

![plotpill.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2650836545-plotpill.png)
content.html: Just a note for the future. When you start moving pills around, the order in which they are in the y field may become different from the order they show on the canvas:

content.raw:
* It seems that by default you can drag part of the plot using the left mouse button. At the end it doesn't do anything but creates a weird rendering effect.
* Zoom in/out with the right mouse button is not as smooth as with the scroll wheel.

This is not critical for this pull request but just a thing to try and customize in the future.
content.html:
• It seems that by default you can drag part of the plot using the left mouse button. At the end it doesn't do anything but creates a weird rendering effect.
  • Zoom in/out with the right mouse button is not as smooth as with the scroll wheel.

This is not critical for this pull request but just a thing to try and customize in the future.
